font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lineage is as\nfollows- <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>SVAYAMBHUVA &nbsp;MANU&nbsp; ( 8275\nBC ) \u2014 PRIYA VARTA ( 8255 BC )-&nbsp; AGNIDHARA\n\u2013 NABHI RAJA -- &nbsp;RISHABHA (8190 BC )&nbsp;&nbsp; \u2013 BHARATA ( 8165 BC )</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I\nhave heard that Vi\u015bv\u0101vasu, the great Gandharva, his mind stupefied with\ninfatuation, fell from his vimana after seeing your daughter ( Devahuti\ndaughter of Svayambhuva Manu ) playing with a ball on the roof of the palace,\nfor she was indeed beautiful with her tinkling ankle bells and her eyes moving to\nand fro.--</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> <b>(SB 3.22.17)</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bharat ( along with\nIndia) is the official English name of Republic of India and Bharata Ga\u1e47arajya\nis the official Sanskrit name of our country. The first clause of the Indian Constitution\nbegins with the words: &nbsp;\u201c India, that is\nBharat,\u2026.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rishabh\nwas born to Merudevi, &nbsp;Bharat was born to\nRishabh, &nbsp;Bharatvarsha was named from\nBharat, and Sumati arose from Bharat</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. &nbsp;<b>(\nVishnu Purana 2.1.31 )<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\ncountry is known as Bharatavarsha,Since the time the father entrusted the\nKingdom to the son, And himself went to the forest for ascetic practices</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.\n&nbsp;<b>(\nVishnu Purana 2.1.32 )<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This fact has been\nattested by the Vishnu Puran (2,1,31), Vayu Puran (33,52), Ling Puran\n(1,47,23), Brahmand Puran (14,5,62), Agni Puran ( 107,11-12), Skanda Puran\n(37,57) and Markandeya Puran (50,41)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emperor Rishabha has\n100 sons and two daughters . His eldest son was Bharata from Sumangala and the\neldest son from his second wife Sunanda was Bahubali.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Nabhi built the\ngreat capital of Ayodhya ( of Babri Masjid fame ) 10000 years ago, for his son\nRishabha , and Kuber spent a large amount of gold in building this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0924\u0936\u094d\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u093e\u0930\u0924\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0930\u094d\u0937\u092e\u0947\u0924\u0932\u094d\u0932\u094b\u0915\u0947\u0937\u0941\u0917\u0940\u092f\u0924\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0930\u0924\u093e\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0930\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0924\u094d\u0924\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0924\u093f\u0937\u094d\u0920\u093f\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0928\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\ncountry is known as Bharatavarsha since the times the father entrusted the\nkingdom to the son Bharata and he himself went to the forest for ascetic\npractices</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> \u2014(Vishnu Purana)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Chakravarti Bharata ( son\nof Sumangala ) conquered the whole world.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8TUoC8LljJg/Ua4rgT879qI/AAAAAAAAi-o/Fq_A8fwsF18/s1600/adinth.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8TUoC8LljJg/Ua4rgT879qI/AAAAAAAAi-o/Fq_A8fwsF18/s320/adinth.jpg\" width=\"283\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After conquering the\nworld he sent a communication to his brothers to accept his order. &nbsp;After an initial hesitation 98 brothers\naccepted Bharata\u2019s order.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now Bahubali ( son of\nSunanda ) was left. When the messenger came to him with message he said \u2013 \u201cO\nmessenger! Go and tell your emperor Bharat that Bahubali isn\u2019t like his\nbrothers who became Sadhus leaving the kingdom. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally emperor Bharat\nattacked on Takshshila kingdom of Bahubali. Army of both sides fought hard.\nSometimes army of Bharat dominated army of Bahubali and sometimes vice versa.\nSeeing mass destruction in war it was decided that there should be a single\ncombat between Bharat and Bahubali . &nbsp;One\nwho wins will be the only Chakravarti or \"Emperor of Emperors\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In all the stages of\nbattle Bharat had to face terrible defeat at the hands of his younger brother Bahubali in all these fights.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a point\ncame that Bahubali must give a lethal strike on his elder half brother Bharata,\nhe raised his hand . He felt that his own sister Sundari and step sister Brahmi\n( of script Brahmi Lipi fame ) were on the side of Bharata.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead of giving the final fatal blow, he suddenly\nuprooted &nbsp;a large tuft of hair from his\nown head instead, thus declaring himself as a monk, stunning all .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After ruling for\nseveral years Bharata also became a wandering saint, like his father and\nbrother..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bahubali spent many\nyears in meditation and severe penance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to legend, he stood\nmeditating for such a long time that anthills formed on the ground where he stood,\nsnakes climbed on his head and creepers grew all over him. But he did not\nattain omniscience &nbsp;( keval jnaan)\nbecause he had an ego and indignation burn problem, that he stood on the ground\nowned by his brother Bharata. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For this\nreason, he could not shed perception-obscuring delusions and obstructing karmas\nthat influence the soul. &nbsp;Finally one day\nBharata came and reconciled with him, his ego vanished and he attained\nomniscience ( nirvana ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today pilgrims visit\nthe colossal statue of Bahubali (Gomateshwar ) stands 59 feet high on the hill\nVindhyagiri at Shravanabelgola near Mysore.&nbsp;\nIt is the tallest known monolithic statue in the world carved out of a\nsingle huge granite boulder. .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6iEuuRMdmoQ/Ua4rQ1H9AuI/AAAAAAAAi-g/hPD9hXAPv_0/s1600/download.jpg+HJGUIRV.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6iEuuRMdmoQ/Ua4rQ1H9AuI/AAAAAAAAi-g/hPD9hXAPv_0/s400/download.jpg+HJGUIRV.jpg\" width=\"299\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 1000th anniversary of the statue was\nobserved between February 19 and 24, 1981, and the great head bathing ceremony\nwas performed. &nbsp;Bahubali \u201cthe would be\nChakaravarti who chose to be a monk\u201d, is revered by Hindus and Jains alike as\nan &nbsp;ideal man who conquers selfishness,\njealousy, pride and anger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to non-existant\nKalidasa, India was named Bharata due to Bharata the son of Dushyanta and\nShakuntala. This view is not supported by the Puranas.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small; line-height: 150%;\">The story of </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Shakuntala</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; has been added as an appendage in the Mahabharata ( Adiparva chapter ) by the white historian. &nbsp; Raja Ravi Varma who painted the non-</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">existent</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Radha ( mistress of Lord Krishna ) does the honours for Shakuntala too.</span></span></span></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalidasa\u2019s play Abhij\u00f1\u0101na\u015b\u0101kuntala (The Sign of Shakuntala) ( HIS LAST WORK) narrates\nthe story..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE- King Dushyanta\nfirst encountered Shakuntala while travelling through the forest with his army.\nHe was pursuing a male deer wounded by his weapon. Shakuntala and Dushyanta\nfell in love with each other and got married. Dushyanta left for his kingdom,\npromising to come back soon and take Shakuntala with him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XuFgot5UzQ0/Ua4c_VjUbkI/AAAAAAAAi9g/FDNI2FV56u4/s1600/220px-Raja_Ravi_Varma_-_Mahabharata_-_Shakuntala.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XuFgot5UzQ0/Ua4c_VjUbkI/AAAAAAAAi9g/FDNI2FV56u4/s400/220px-Raja_Ravi_Varma_-_Mahabharata_-_Shakuntala.jpg\" width=\"236\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakuntala spent much\ntime dreaming of her new husband and was often distracted by her daydreams. One\nday, a powerful rishi, Durvasa, came to the ashrama but, lost in her thoughts about\nDushyanta, Shakuntala failed to greet him properly. Incensed by this slight,\nthe rishi cursed Shakuntala, saying that the person she was dreaming of would\nforget about her altogether.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mdJXKuY7W5I/Ua4dUreBKDI/AAAAAAAAi9o/v42Qltpb7Qc/s1600/220px-1940s_Vintage_Hindu_Print_Dushyant_&amp;_Shakuntala.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mdJXKuY7W5I/Ua4dUreBKDI/AAAAAAAAi9o/v42Qltpb7Qc/s320/220px-1940s_Vintage_Hindu_Print_Dushyant_&amp;_Shakuntala.jpg\" width=\"213\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As he departed in a rage, one of Shakuntala's\nfriends quickly explained to him the reason for her friend's distraction. The\nrishi, realizing that his extreme wrath was not warranted, modified his curse\nsaying that the person who had forgotten Shakuntala would remember everything\nagain if she showed him a personal token that had been given to her.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ipWHtVV3nh4/Ua4daOSAvII/AAAAAAAAi9w/AjukNVB6pvM/s1600/220px-Raja_Ravi_Varma_-_Mahabharata_-_Birth_of_Shakuntala.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ipWHtVV3nh4/Ua4daOSAvII/AAAAAAAAi9w/AjukNVB6pvM/s1600/220px-Raja_Ravi_Varma_-_Mahabharata_-_Birth_of_Shakuntala.jpg\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Time passed, and\nShakuntala, wondering why Dushyanta did not return for her, finally set out for\nthe capital city with her father and some of her companions. &nbsp;On the way, they had to cross a river by a canoe\nferry and, seduced by the deep blue waters of the river, Shakuntala ran her\nfingers through the water. &nbsp;Her ring\nslipped off her finger without her realizing it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arriving at Dushyanta's\ncourt, Shakuntala was hurt and surprised when her husband did not recognize\nher, nor recollected anything about her. She tried to remind him that she was\nhis wife but without the ring Dushyanta did not recognize her.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humiliated, she\nreturned to the forests and, collecting her son, settled in a wild part of the\nforest by herself. Here she spent her days while Bharata, her son, grew older.\nSurrounded only by wild animals, Bharata grew to be a strong youth and made a\nsport of opening the mouths of tigers and lions and counting their teeth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-E_S1iX1yQa4/Ua4ddwZgQ1I/AAAAAAAAi94/0iR_qE3rq-A/s1600/220px-Shakuntala_RRV.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-E_S1iX1yQa4/Ua4ddwZgQ1I/AAAAAAAAi94/0iR_qE3rq-A/s1600/220px-Shakuntala_RRV.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile, a fisherman\nwas surprised to find a royal ring in the belly of a fish he had caught.\nRecognizing the royal seal, he took the ring to the palace and, upon seeing his\nring, Dushyanta's memories of his lovely bride came rushing back to him. He\nimmediately set out to find her and, arriving at her father's ashram,\ndiscovered that she was no longer there.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">He continued deeper into the forest to\nfind his wife and came upon a surprising scene in the forest: a young boy had\npried open the mouth of a lion and was busy counting its teeth. The king\ngreeted the boy, amazed by his boldness and strength, and asked his name. He\nwas surprised when the boy answered that he was <b>Bharata, the son of King Dushyanta</b>. The boy took him to Shakuntala,\nand thus the family was reunited.UNQUOTE ( Wikipedia )</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalidasa was unknown to\nIndians , and his most well known work about Shakuntala &nbsp;was the first work of Kalidasa to be\ntranslated into English from which was made a German translation in 1791 that\nevoked the often quoted admiration by Goethe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you read the English\ntranslations they look too perfect to be translated from Sanskrit , with\nrhymes, and the typical metering of Goethe. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0Tsh7wOI4-U/Ua4qkFIcs0I/AAAAAAAAi-I/ARuXYpdsZW4/s1600/Goethe.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0Tsh7wOI4-U/Ua4qkFIcs0I/AAAAAAAAi-I/ARuXYpdsZW4/s1600/Goethe.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalidasa's verse\nknowledge is deep. He has used most of the known meters (chhanda) in Sanskrit.\nIn one chapter he uses only one meter. The next chapter is in a new meter. The\nwhole of `Meghadoota' is in `mandaa-krantaa' meter (2-2-2, 2-1-1, 1-1-1, 2-2-1,\n2-2-1, 2-2).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild\u2019s pet poet\nGoethe &nbsp;took an extra-ordinary interests\nin Kalidasa's Abhij\u00f1\u0101na\u015b\u0101kuntalam, which was the first works of Sanskrit\nliterature that became known in Europe, &nbsp;after\nbeing translated from English to German. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">German Jew Goethe\ngushes-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Willst\ndu die Bl\u00fcthe des fr\u00fchen, die Fr\u00fcchte des sp\u00e4teren Jahres,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Willst\ndu, was reizt und entz\u00fcckt, willst du was s\u00e4ttigt und n\u00e4hrt,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Willst\ndu den Himmel, die Erde, mit Einem Namen begreifen;<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nenn\u2019\nich, Sakuntala, Dich, and so ist Alles gesagt.</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014Goethe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wouldst thou the young\nyear's blossoms and the fruits of its decline<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And all by which the\nsoul is charmed, enraptured, feasted, fed,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wouldst thou the earth\nand heaven itself in one sole name combine?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I name thee, O\nSakuntala! and all at once is said.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No orthodox Hindu ever\nused the name of Kalidasa in India in 600 AD or before. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No Hindu Sanskrit\nscholar would write about Shiva and Parvati ( eroticism ) the way it was done\nby Kalidasa. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#########################</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>Digression:-</b></i></span><br />\n<i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Nowadays the Christian\nwhite man is busy writing erotic stories of \u201cthe consummation of the marriage\nbetween Mohammed the Prophet and his first child wife Aisha\u201d on the Internet. &nbsp;They take care to be anonymous, lest they lose\ntheir head at the sharp end of a sword. &nbsp;</b></span></i><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Wikipedia is bold\nenough to write- &nbsp;punch into google search<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> AISHA WIKIPEDIA</span><o:p></o:p></b></span></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>&nbsp;QUOTE Aisha was six or seven years old when\nshe was betrothed to Muhammad, and nine when the marriage was consummated . They\nbathed in the same water and he prayed while she lay stretched out in front of\nhim. UNQUOTE</b></span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">And if you punch into\nGoogle search <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">MUHAMMAD\u2019S WIVES&nbsp; WIKIPEDIA</span>\n, it reads--<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE Muhammad &nbsp;and his family lived in small apartments\nadjacent the mosque at Medina. Each of these were six to seven spans wide (5.5\nfeet) and ten spans long (7.5 feet). The height of the ceiling was that of an\naverage man standing. The blankets were used as curtains to screen the\ndoors.[77] According to an account by Anas bin Malik said, \"The Prophet\nused to visit all his wives in a round, during the day and night and they were ELEVEN\nin number.\"UNQUOTE&nbsp;</span></i></b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">They further list the\nnames of Muhammad\u2019s wives too \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">1)Khadija bint\nKhuwaylid ( at the age of 25)&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">2)Sawda bint Zam\u02bfa<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">3)Aisha bint Abi Bakr ( at the age of 53 )<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">4)Hafsa bint Umar<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">5)Zaynab bint Khuzayma<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">6)Hind bint Abi Umayya<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">7)Zaynab bint Jahsh<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">8)Juwayriyya bint\nal-Harith<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">9)Rayhana bint Zayd<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">10)Safiyya bint Huyayy<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">11)Ramla bint Abi\nSufyan<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">12)Maria al-Qibtiyya<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">13)Maymuna bint\nal-Harith ( at the age of 60)</span></b></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></i></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############################</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And pray why is\nKalidasa so familiar with Greek astronomy?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kumarasambhava , is\nconcerned with the events that lead to the marriage of the god Shiva and Parvati,\ndaughter of the Himalaya. This union was desired by the gods for the production\nof a son, Kumaara, god of war, who would help them defeat the demon Taraka. &nbsp;The gods induce Kama, god of love, to\ndischarge an amatory arrow at Shiva who is engrossed in meditation. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Angered by this interruption of his\nausterities, he burns Kaama to ashes with a glance of his third eye. &nbsp;But love for Parvati has been aroused, and it\nculminates in their marriage. The last few cantos are usually omitted from\nprinted versions, being of an excessively erotic and grossly sexual nature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is especially true of Canto VIII where the embraces of the newly-wedded\ndivine couple are dwelled upon in vivid and coarse detail. &nbsp;Is there any reason to glorify lust between a\nGod Lord Shiva and his wife Goddess Parvati?&nbsp;\nIt is NO shringaara- fu#kin' -rasa by any stretch of imagination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dr S. Radhakrishnan th\nex-President of India and an eminent scholar wrote &nbsp;QUOTE `Whichever date we adopt for him (\nKalidasa ) we are in the realm of reasonable conjecture and nothing more. &nbsp;&nbsp;Kalidasa speaks very little of himself, and\nwe cannot therefore be sure of his authorship of many works attributed to him. &nbsp;We do not know any details of his life. &nbsp;Numerous legends have gathered round his name,\nwhich have no historical value'UNQUOTE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">The British went\noverboard in hailing Kalidasa as the Indian Shakespeare. &nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Why not -- the English verses\nof Kalidasa read exactly the way a British poet would write in times of Goethe. &nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">This\nis NOT the style of Sanskrit poets of 600 AD.</span><o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mr Horace Hayman Wilson\nwas the first to translate Kalidasa into English in the year 1813.&nbsp; An excerpt from his so called reverse\ntranslation:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cPleased\non each terrace dancing with delight<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nfriendly peacock hails thy grateful flight:<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Delay\nthen, certain in Ujjain to find<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All\nthat restores the frame or cheers the mind,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence\nwith new zeal to Siva homage pay,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nGod whom earth, and hell, and heaven obey:<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\nat his shoulders like a dusky robe,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantling\nimpend thy vast and shadowy globe:<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where\nample forests, stretched its skirts below,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Projecting\ntrees like dangling limbs bestow:<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\nvermeil roses fiercely blooming shed<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their\nrich reflected glow, their blood-resembling red.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Is above verse an\nancient Indian Sanskrit scholar style by any stretch of imagination?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">British stooge and\nNobel Prize winner, Rabindranath Tagore gushes on and on about Kalidasa- though\nthe rest of India were wondering who the mysterious and anonymous . Kalidasa could\nbe and Sanskrit scholars were left arguing about when he lived, and the dates\nbeing discussed are half a millennium apart. &nbsp;KD Sethna in his book entitled , \"\nProblems of Ancient India \" ,&nbsp; lists\nthe time of Kalidasa as one of the 11 unsolved problems of ancient India .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\ndrenched your noble stanzas.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalidasa is portrayed\nas the follower of the Vedic Sanatana dharma. &nbsp;He believed in the four social castes. So this\nmeans the white Christian invader did NOT inject the poison of caste system ,right?\n&nbsp;See, eminent poets like Kalidasa wrote\nabout the caste system..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalidas wrote seven\nworks ( sic).&nbsp; 'Kumarasambhava' and\n'Raghuvamsha' are his two epic poems. 'Malavikagnimitra', 'Vikramorvashiya' and\n'Abhijnana Shakuntala' are his plays.&nbsp;\n'Meghaduta' and 'Ritusamhara' are also poetic works .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader did a\nfake back dated &nbsp;Aihole Inscription dated\n634 AD, which mentions Kalidasa as a contemporary and a court-poet of King\nVikramaditya. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Kottiyoor temple\nis unsung and unknown outside Kerala. &nbsp;Hindus\nin Kerala have tried to keep it that way since recent times. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soulless Kerala communist\ngovernments and successive Italian Queen Bee\u2019s governments under the influence\nof JOSHUA PROJECT 2 , have tried their best to take away the temple lands\naround this most holy and ancient spot for Hindus around the world, quoting the\nenvironment . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They want the Hindus to\ngive up their souls for a few wild pigs and bison. &nbsp;Remember foreign funded Christian NGOs and\natheist rationalist NGOs are still trying to make the trekking areas to\nSabarimala, a restricted animal sanctuary. &nbsp;Sabarimala\nhas beaten the Kumbh Mela in numbers when you average out the figures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Earlier in 1971 , 27,000\nacres of Kottiyoor Temple land was captured under Indian Forest laws in an\narbitrary manner.&nbsp; &nbsp;After a sustained legal tussle &nbsp;in 1980, &nbsp;107 acres of land full of medicinal herbs and\nspecial trees surrounding the temple was given back to Kottiyoor temple\nauthorities. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kerala Government ,\n(with communists and Christians at the helm) &nbsp;, who has NIL respect for ancient Indian\nculture and more respect for Islamic Saudi and Catholic Italy culture ,\nchallenged the court order in Supreme Court, but fortunately the Indian Supreme\nCourt dismissed the Kerala Government appeal. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
