font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The forest ministry\nsend notice to Kottiyoor temple again to capture the left over land citing the\nland as ecologically fragile- &nbsp;the whole\nidea to to erase this part of Hindu history dated to antiquity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I will now let the rest\nof India know why this temple is so important to our Indian culture. This is who\nwe are.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile we suffered\n800 years of slavery under Muslim and Christian invaders ,who converted Indians\nto Islam and Christianity.&nbsp; These people\nwho been born into the&nbsp; religions of\ntheir parents ( forced by sword and sops ) do NOT care for Indian ancient\nIndian culture \u2014 it has become poison for them.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindus in Andhra\nPradesh will remember how chief minister YSR , with the connivance of the\nItalian Queen Bee ( Joshua Project 2 ) , tried to capture the holy Tirumala hills\nand plant a cross. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Or for the matter how\nthe foreign funded Tamilian Christian missionary NGOs destroyed the Vivekananda memorial and\nplanted a cross at Rameshwaram rock, &nbsp;giving\npropaganda that it was NOT Swami Vivekananda who meditated there, but Portuguese\nmissionary Francis Xavier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-s7s0lUPda1c/UasZXFCjHbI/AAAAAAAAi5A/A2kUiWVkXF0/s1600/downloadhkp%5B't.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"285\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-s7s0lUPda1c/UasZXFCjHbI/AAAAAAAAi5A/A2kUiWVkXF0/s400/downloadhkp%5B't.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now let me first narrate\nthe lore--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legend goes that Sati\nwas born when the gods concentrated their energy at a point on the ground to\ncreate a girl powerful enough to destroy even the fiercest of demons. &nbsp;The goddess, took human birth at the bidding\nof the god Brahma. &nbsp;Beautiful and chaste Sati\nwas born as the youngest daughter of Daksha Prajapati and his wife\nPrasuti.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Daksha was a son of\nBrahma and a great king and magnate in his own right. The girl was named Gauri,\n\"the turmeric-hued one,\" &nbsp;As\nthe daughter of Daksha, she is also known as Dakshayani. She is also called Sati\nBy this logic, Sati is grand-daughter of Brahma by Daksha, but is also great\ngrand-daughter of Brahma because Prasuti is daughter of Manu (Manu is son of\nBrahma).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In bidding the Goddess\nto take human birth, Brahma's design was that she should please Shiva with\nhumble devotions and wed him. &nbsp;It was\nnatural that Gauri ( Sati ) , even as a child, adored the tales and legends\nassociated with Shiva and grew up an ardent devotee. &nbsp;As Sati grew to womanhood, the idea of\nmarrying anyone else, as intended by her father, became anathema to her.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every proposal from handsome,\nvaliant and rich kings made her crave ever more for the firm limbed ascetic of\nKailasa, the God of Gods, who bestowed all on this world and himself foreswore\nall. &nbsp;To win the regard of the ascetic\nShiva, the daughter of king Daksha forsook the luxuries of her father's palace\nand retired to a forest, there to devote herself to austerities and the worship\nof Shiva. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So rigorous were her\npenances that she gradually renounced food itself, at one stage subsisting on\none bilva leaf a day, and then giving up even that nourishment; this particular\nabstinence earned her the sobriquet Aparn\u0101. &nbsp;Her prayers finally bore fruit when, after\ntesting her resolve, Shiva finally acceded to her wishes and consented to make\nher his bride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An ecstatic Sati\nreturned to her father's home to await her bridegroom, but found her father\nless than elated by the turn of events. &nbsp;The\nwedding was however held in due course, and Sati made her home with Shiva in the\nicy Mount Kailasa.&nbsp; &nbsp;Daksha, depicted in legend as an arrogant\nking, did not get on with his renunciative son-in-law and basically cut his\ndaughter away from her natal family.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smouldering in\nindignation, and to get even , Daksha Prajapati, the father of Sati organized a\ngrand yajna to which all the gods were invited, with the exception of his own daughter\nSati and her husband Shiva.&nbsp; Wanting to\nvisit her parents, relatives and childhood friends, Sati sought to rationalize\nthis omission. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She reasoned within\nherself that her parents had neglected to make a formal invitation to them only\nbecause, as family, such formality was unnecessary; certainly, she needed no\ninvitation to visit her own mother and would go anyway. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sati pestered Shiva to come\nalong with her to the Yajna ( homam ). &nbsp;Shiva\nmaintained that they should not go uninvited. &nbsp;&nbsp;Shiva\nsought to dissuade her, but she was resolved upon going; he then provided her with\nan escort of his ganas and bid her provoke no incident.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sati was received\ncoldly by her father. &nbsp;They were soon in\nthe midst of a heated argument about the virtues (and alleged lack thereof) of\nShiva. &nbsp;Every passing moment made it\nclearer to Sati that her father was entirely incapable of appreciating the excellent\nqualities of her husband. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The realization then\ncame to Sati that this abuse was being heaped on Shiva only because he had wed\nher; she was the cause of this dishonour to her husband. &nbsp;Sati noticed that no seat (assan) had been\nearmarked for her husband Shiva, even if he had gone, which meant a deliberate\nattempt to humiliate Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was consumed by\nrage against her father and loathing for his mentality. Calling up a prayer\nthat she may, in a future birth, be born the daughter of a father whom she\ncould respect, Sati made her own body burst into flames by self combustion..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YbsR5aZ5unE/UauJzxifBpI/AAAAAAAAi74/XJzWfp_v4JM/s1600/imagestuio;tr4rf.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YbsR5aZ5unE/UauJzxifBpI/AAAAAAAAi74/XJzWfp_v4JM/s400/imagestuio;tr4rf.jpg\" width=\"321\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The exact spot where\nthe yagya or homam took place , in which Sati self immolated is where the\namazing and powerful Kottiyoor temple is situated in Kerala .&nbsp; This spot is THE oldest spot of Shiva-Sati\nworship in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva sensed this\ncatastrophe, and his rage was incomparable&nbsp;&nbsp;\nShiva rushed to the spot and found Sati half burnt and dead.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He loved Sati more than\nany and would never love after her. In terrible rage he opened his destructive third\neye and there rose &nbsp;Virabhadra and\nBhadrakali, some call as [Manbhadra], two ferocious creatures who wreaked havoc\nand mayhem on the scene of the horrific incident. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PZUMA8g7DFU/UaslQ61IF0I/AAAAAAAAi5o/kJZwpEVgoc8/s1600/imagesbjko;.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PZUMA8g7DFU/UaslQ61IF0I/AAAAAAAAi5o/kJZwpEVgoc8/s400/imagesbjko;.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearly all those present were indiscriminately\nfelled overnight. &nbsp;Daksha himself was\ndecapitated by Shiva with a sword, which is held by Kottiyoor temple.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gruesome deed done\n, Shiva performed the fearsome and awe-inspiring Tandava dance, which caused\nthe entire planet to tremble in fear . Kottiyoor is the place where Sati killed herself by self combustion -and Shiva hacked Daksha with a sword.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva then placed his\nwife Gauri's ( Sati ) body on his shoulder and ran about the world, disconsolate\nand crazed with grief.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rBHXf2f9cpk/UaslHWpeBdI/AAAAAAAAi5g/ZCutbS9WiBU/s1600/ShivaAcceptParvati_22843.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"348\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rBHXf2f9cpk/UaslHWpeBdI/AAAAAAAAi5g/ZCutbS9WiBU/s400/ShivaAcceptParvati_22843.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In order to protect the\nuniverse from the wrath of Shiva, Lord Vishnu dismembered the body of Sati used\nhis Sudarshana Chakra&nbsp; . T he dismembered\nparts of her body fell at 54 different places in India, Turkey, Azaerbaijan and\nSri Lanka. One part fell on planet Venus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These places came to be\nknown as Shaktipeeths or centers of power. &nbsp;These places have become major centers of\npilgrimage as they are held by the Goddess-oriented Shakta sect to be\nparticularly holy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the night of\nhorror, Shiva, the all-forgiving, restored all those who were slain to life and\ngranted them his blessings. Even the abusive and culpable Daksha was restored\nboth his life and his kingship. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His decapitated head\nwas substituted for that of a goat. Having learned his lesson, Daksha spent his\nremaining years as a devotee of Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-e0Ldsa9TgO4/Uask_k4r_jI/AAAAAAAAi5Y/B7AOEztIhiw/s1600/downloadhhy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-e0Ldsa9TgO4/Uask_k4r_jI/AAAAAAAAi5Y/B7AOEztIhiw/s400/downloadhhy.jpg\" width=\"283\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sat\u012b,&nbsp; reincarnated as&nbsp; Parvati , Shiva\u2019s second wife and is the\nmother of Lord Ganesha&nbsp; and Lord Skanda\n(Kartikeya).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ucKiTvlcG5c/UbcoD0QKJuI/AAAAAAAAjKw/jrCSqtRoRNE/s1600/jghkjg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ucKiTvlcG5c/UbcoD0QKJuI/AAAAAAAAjKw/jrCSqtRoRNE/s400/jghkjg.jpg\" width=\"294\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">She is also known by\n108 names from the Durga Saptashati. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her\ndifferent mood brings different forms or incarnation. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Parvati is considered to be Goddess Kali\nherself in her most ferocious form. As Durga she is black in color and rides on\nlion, she is known as the original slayer of Demon Mahishasura.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">54 Shakti Peethas of\nSati, proves that all Goddesses are expansions of the Goddess Parvati.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Sri yantra\ndivine geometry , revealed in 8000 BC to the Maharishi seers , the 3 lines\nintersect at 54 points ( number of sanskrit alphabets ) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With Shiva and Shakti\nqualities&nbsp; ( Yin Yang ) making the magic\nnumber 108, or the number of beads in a Rudraksha mala<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-RRbZbOx9m4Q/XF4bcFVZp-I/AAAAAAABfvg/escR3muORD0eWscW-1DqEfAUAFbWoYiSgCLcBGAs/s1600/kottiyRRoor-temple-011.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"601\" data-original-width=\"955\" height=\"402\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-RRbZbOx9m4Q/XF4bcFVZp-I/AAAAAAABfvg/escR3muORD0eWscW-1DqEfAUAFbWoYiSgCLcBGAs/s640/kottiyRRoor-temple-011.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later Lord Shiva&nbsp; took the form of Swayambhu linga&nbsp;&nbsp; and stayed next to where Sati immolated\nherself.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since all the gods and\ngoddesses were present in the place , it got to be known as Koodiyur ( renamed\nby British as Kottiyoor ).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-XeoCvRXw8hI/Uasw-8Ud2WI/AAAAAAAAi7A/mGpE4DceE0s/s1600/IMG_0238.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"411\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-XeoCvRXw8hI/Uasw-8Ud2WI/AAAAAAAAi7A/mGpE4DceE0s/s640/IMG_0238.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i>Above: Akkare Kottiyoor temple.</i></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This sport is called\nAkkare Kottiyoor temple. &nbsp;Akkare means\nthe other side of the Bavali river bank. Due to age and antiquity there is\nnothing there today , but a Manithara ( heap of stones ) with a Shiva Lingam .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a knee deep water pond ( Thiruvanchira ) around this Manithara with the swayambu Shiva\nLingam, in which the devotees stand .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swayambhu\nmeans born on its own or not man made. &nbsp;Devotees can feel the power of this lingam.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearby in the same lake\nthere is another heap of stones , known as Ammarakallu which is worshipped as Sati.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">WATER FLOWS IN A MOBIUS COIL PATTERN GENERATING A SCALAR FIELD.</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/vg0ywyhvrjY/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/vg0ywyhvrjY&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/vg0ywyhvrjY&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Sthala\nPurana , this spot was visited by Lord Parashurama when he came down to Kerala\nin 4000 BC from the Saraswati river. &nbsp;And\nsince it was difficult for any devotee to cross the torrential river, an Ikkare\nKottiyoor temple made of stone was consecrated. Ikkare means this side of the Bavali\nriver bank.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-aJY_FcNiN3Y/UaskZ8OxJUI/AAAAAAAAi5Q/47q5bvQ8v9E/s1600/Image004.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-aJY_FcNiN3Y/UaskZ8OxJUI/AAAAAAAAi5Q/47q5bvQ8v9E/s640/Image004.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This festival will be\nheld on the Chothi asterism month of Edavam and culminates on the Chithira asterism\nof the Mithunam month<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Akkare Kottiyoor temple\n, where there is only a mount of stones with a shiva lingam , remains open only\non these 27 festival days . &nbsp;Daily\nworship is held at Ikkare Kottiyoor temple. &nbsp;But during these 27 days of festival at Akkare\nKottiyoor temple, &nbsp;the Ikkare temple remains\nclosed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-eBGJ8IpqeNM/Uaslq_erH8I/AAAAAAAAi5w/NTg66Rz8kNk/s1600/images.jpgGTGI.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-eBGJ8IpqeNM/Uaslq_erH8I/AAAAAAAAi5w/NTg66Rz8kNk/s400/images.jpgGTGI.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 'abhishekam'\n(offering) here is with milk, &nbsp;ghee\n(clarified butter) and elannir vellam (tender coconut water). &nbsp;Pilgrims to the temple, before trekking through\nthe dense forests to the magnificent valley of the&nbsp; Sahya mountain ranges, take a bath in the\nRiver Bavali, which is considered to be divine. During this time of the year\nthe heavens do NOT rain, they pour\u2014and the waters can be fast and torrential.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pigrims have a\ndress code. They are not allowed to wear western pants and shirts. They have to\nwear a dhoti or mundu. Everybody has a local bath towel called thorthu on his\nshoulder.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-E9TopYD9uu8/Uaso9EEeITI/AAAAAAAAi6A/wuIE8nQTvDw/s1600/picture-069.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-E9TopYD9uu8/Uaso9EEeITI/AAAAAAAAi6A/wuIE8nQTvDw/s400/picture-069.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Auda Flower (\nodapoo ) is considered as the symbol of Kottiyoor festival. &nbsp;It is representative of the &nbsp;beard of the decapitated king Daksha. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/bHE5kVnSuXw/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/bHE5kVnSuXw&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/bHE5kVnSuXw&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is an artificial flower made of bamboo, and\nit will be created only during festival season. This flower is available only\nin Kottiyoor. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everybody buys the\nOdapoo or Auda flowers before leaving for home.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a sign that you have visited Kottiyoor.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is hung at the entrance to your home as\na lucky charm.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FA0Dyktv338/UaspT5hgH1I/AAAAAAAAi6I/qVvNjWeh_Yo/s1600/picture-051.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FA0Dyktv338/UaspT5hgH1I/AAAAAAAAi6I/qVvNjWeh_Yo/s640/picture-051.jpg\" width=\"476\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The festival also known\nas Akkare Kottiyoor Vaisakha Maholsavam festival will begin with a sword from\nMuthirikavu Temple in Tavinal village , taken to Akkare Kottiyur temple. &nbsp;&nbsp;It was\nbelieved that Daksha was hacked to death &nbsp;by this sword. &nbsp;The sword is made of alloy and is passivated\nwith a protective patina . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Neyyattam ( offering of\nghee ) and Elaneerattam( offering of tender coconut water) are special rituals\nconnected with the festival.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similar temporary huts\ncover the two deities of Shiva and Sati. &nbsp;A stone-walled channel, rather a ourished moat\n, through which living water courses, &nbsp;connects the temple ground to the &nbsp;river.&nbsp;\nStanding knee deep in water, throng thousands of devotees, &nbsp;bare-chested men in white dhotis and women in\nsarees.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wq6X5S81ADs/Uaswj_R7bYI/AAAAAAAAi6w/uNgRepWMEuk/s1600/03.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wq6X5S81ADs/Uaswj_R7bYI/AAAAAAAAi6w/uNgRepWMEuk/s400/03.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Above : Ikkare Shiva temple consecrated by Lord Parashurama.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the water temple\nelephants sashay with idols on top and sword and shield-carrying priests\npreceeding them. &nbsp;&nbsp;In the &nbsp;theyyam stage, every evening dancers re-enact\nthe Shiva Sati story. &nbsp;'Bhandaram\nEzhunnallath', is a ritual of divine ornaments being brought in procession from\nthe nearby Manathana village to the temple.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2VEli-iyvVU/Uaswz1uBK7I/AAAAAAAAi64/-QO3go4I_yU/s1600/6004491691_ce89ef435b_z.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"271\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2VEli-iyvVU/Uaswz1uBK7I/AAAAAAAAi64/-QO3go4I_yU/s400/6004491691_ce89ef435b_z.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can feel divine\nenergy the moment you step on this antique mythical land. &nbsp;The devotees running into hundreds of\nthousands go home with a deep inexplicable bond with this remote place deep in\nthe vibrant jungle. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rTfxdgVNDLU/UasxPyB_b1I/AAAAAAAAi7I/Pb2rW9lRdqY/s1600/6005037836_51f2a4451e_z.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"285\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rTfxdgVNDLU/UasxPyB_b1I/AAAAAAAAi7I/Pb2rW9lRdqY/s400/6005037836_51f2a4451e_z.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine a Manithara (\nheap of stones ) with a Shiva Lingam, steeped in legend , in the middle of a\nwater pool , identified by Lord Parashurama 6000 years ago, is the only visible\nsigns of this most holy spot of hoary antiquity.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Why do the devotees\nstand in knee deep water at Kottiyoor?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-AW1L5QAyE/UaswPJFvXmI/AAAAAAAAi6Y/Dp5RhTO_yTY/s1600/10.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-AW1L5QAyE/UaswPJFvXmI/AAAAAAAAi6Y/Dp5RhTO_yTY/s1600/10.gif\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bavali river brings\nnano size colloids of herbs and healing minerals from the Wayanad hills . This\nis what living water or bio-energised miracle water is all about.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low surface tension\nwater ( normal is 73 dynes ) can store information for healing in its vibratory\nstructure . Molecules of water are affected by our thoughts, words, and\nfeelings. The average electron density around the oxygen atom in a water\nmolecule is about 10 times that around the hydrogen atoms. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This non uniform distribution of positive and\nnegative charges or strong dipole &nbsp;present in water leads to the substance\u2019s\nunusual behavior. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A single molecule of\nwater looks like a letter V at an angle of 105 deg , with one oxygen atom at\nthe bottom point and two hydrogen atoms at the top. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A heavy chest\ncontaining a 47 gram metal alloy idol was &nbsp;given to CIA officials for safekeeping at Lo\nMonthang &nbsp;(called \u201cMustang\u201d in CIA files)\nby a Tibetan monk accompanied by Khampa bodyguards in 1959. &nbsp;&nbsp;The monk apparently verbally told CIA\nofficials the importance of the chest and its contents which the CIA wrote down.\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/--nrKVyPKlr4/UaQiuOs9seI/AAAAAAAAixI/ATH917mgKZE/s1600/afca4w+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: red;\">Above: The upper right hand holds the shankh and the bottom right hand show a static Sudarsha Chakra.</span></i></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chest was kept in a\nCIA store-room in Washington DC labeled \u201cST Circus Mustang-0183\u201d in the army\nbase of Camp Hale , near Vail , Colarado.. &nbsp;When they opened the chest an ancient manuscript\nwas found with the idol inside .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chest was so magnificent\nthat it provoked lot of excitement and curiosity. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This heavy metal-lined wooden chest had a socket-and-pivot\nhinged lid and an ancient loop-and-rod lock assembly. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was a cubical box of more than 8 inch\nsquare. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The teak box wood was 6 inches\nthick.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The teak-wood timber\nwas further with an inner lining of one inch thick bronze-like alloy plate on\nall sides which despite severe external corrosion had preserved the teak-wood\nof the box to a fair extent. &nbsp;The metal\nplate was riveted into the teakwood with nails of similar metal alloy, a work\nof great expertise. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-VTWqsSfixww/UaQizhYJU0I/AAAAAAAAixQ/D8VVB0sf7mM/s1600/download.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; The major vaults are not opened due to supreme court order, citing lack of security.</b></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ABCK1x8nsDQ/UaQkundddzI/AAAAAAAAixw/vB3ziY_4vHU/s1600/uo8fy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ABCK1x8nsDQ/UaQkundddzI/AAAAAAAAixw/vB3ziY_4vHU/s320/uo8fy.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"306\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The appearance of\nthe chest suggested that it might have lain buried for a considerable period of\ntime.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This box and contents was\nsent for carbon dating . The idol , the lining, the rivets, the wooden slat manuscript, the box wood, the inner organic deposits in crevices &nbsp;\u2013all were carbon dated ( C14 ) by the University of California Radiation\nLaboratory, Berkeley .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
